reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked this pension as we were just needing a base whilst exploring Prague. It was very clean and the breakfast of yogurt and cold meats and coffee was fine to start off the day. Rooms are very basic and not soundproofed so you wouldn't want to spend more than a couple of nights here just in case. However it was very good value for money though a little basic. Allowed to check in early. Very easy to get to from the airport bus then metro Mustek. Very central we walked everywhere. All in all if you are just spending 2 nights exploring Prague then its fine.
reviews.title: Fine as a base

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights, all the staff are extremely helpful and friendly. The twin room was basic, cleaned every day with fresh towels provided. In the room is a fridge, twin hot plate, kettle and microwave but cooking and eating utensils are very limited, it would be a struggle to prepare any meals. The shower / toilet area was very basic and small but hot water was always available.
reviews.title: A long football weekend

reviews.text: Pension Alabastr is a clean warm bed in a great location minutes from Wenceslas Square. If you're expecting luxury this isn't it, but it is particularly keenly priced.
reviews.title: A Reliable Choice

reviews.text: Wifi is a bit patchy and some of the rooms are noisy, but otherwise a recommended stay.
reviews.title: It's a Pension - not a luxury hotel - staff friendly and helpful

reviews.text: Always wanted to visit this city and booked this place - as a friend had booked there.
reviews.title: Best Location, Helpfull Staff, Nice Room
